tests.name: Test 1: Complex Proto-Language Reconstruction
tests.description: Analyze complex proto-language patterns across multiple language families
tests.prompt:
Given these cognate sets from three distinct language families (Indo-European, Sino-Tibetan, and Niger-Congo), reconstruct the proto-forms and explain the systematic sound changes that led to the modern forms. Consider both regular sound laws and analogical changes:

Indo-European 'water': Sanskrit आप् (āp-), Greek ὕδωρ (hudōr), Latin aqua, Gothic watō
Sino-Tibetan 'water': Mandarin 水 (shuǐ), Tibetan ཆུ (chu), Burmese ရေ (re)
Niger-Congo 'water': Swahili maji, Yoruba omi, Shona mvura

tests.name: Test 51: Advanced Community Code-Switching Analysis
tests.description: Analyze complex code-switching patterns in multilingual community context
tests.prompt:
Analyze this conversation from a trilingual Chicano community in East LA where speakers strategically use English, Spanish, and Nahuatl for different social functions:

Abuela: 'Mira, mijo, when you go to escuela, you speak English, ¿verdad? Pero aquí en casa, our corazón speaks español and our ancestors speak Nahuatl. Tonali means 'sun' in our original tongue.'

Teenager: 'But Abuela, at school they say speaking Spanish makes you seem less... you know, less American. And nobody even knows what Nahuatl is.'
